forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Light Rain Likely then Partly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 10pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a soft drizzle begins to murmur against the pavement, echoing the city’s familiar rhythm. The sky wears a heavy cloak of gray, shrouding the Golden Gate Bridge in mist, while the distant outlines of the cityscape blur into a watercolor dream. With temperatures hovering near a cool 59, it’s a time when that quintessential San Francisco chill penetrates the day, nudging you toward a cozy embrace of your wardrobe. Layering is advisable; a light rain jacket over a warm sweater will create a stable alliance against the elements. 

As evening settles in, the chance of rain persists—a quiet continuation of the mood established earlier. The winds, a lively companion to the rain, will swirl around at brisk speeds, rustling leaves and echoing a warning to secure your hats. With a low of 48, venturing out may involve tags of warmth to stave off the encroaching coolness. It’s the sort of day that encourages a leisurely stroll through the cozy corners of a local cafe, perhaps cradling a warm drink as you watch the world pass by, or indulging in the embrace of a beloved book by the fireside. Outdoor explorations may seem less inviting, but delving into the galleries and cafes bathed in soft light can bloom into a delightful escape from the dampened streets.
